newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE CANOLA FALLS ON LONG LIQUIDATION AT MIDSESSION.
newsitem.headline: WCE CANOLA FALLS ON LONG LIQUIDATION AT MIDSESSION.

text.p: Winnipeg Commodity Exchange canola futures traded down on long liquidation ahead of Tuesday's U.S. Department of Agriculture U.S. production estimates.
"There's long liquidation of the August and the November. The trade's cautious ahead of the USDA report," a trader said.

Cargill bought November at $356 from other commercials and locals, floor sources said. There were few hedges in September. November WCE canola crush profit margin fell to -19.12 Monday from -14.47 Friday. Sep-Nov spread at $2.
August canola was down $3.20 at $354.50 at 1130 CDT and November was $3.40 lower at $357.20.
November flax lost $2.50, and traded at $29p $2.60 to $134.90 on commission house short covering as buy stops were triggered. Commercials were scale up sellers.
October feed wheat rose $0.70 to $155.50 as XCan bought from UGG, December down $0.30 to $155, a trader said.
Peas and oats did not trade.
(All values in Canadian dollars per tonne except oats, feed peas.)
